entries.philosopher_50: Experience is that thing you gain right after you need it.
entries.philosopher_49: Every man dies.  Not every man lives.
entries.philosopher_48: All beings are equal as far as death is concerned.
entries.philosopher_47: Only the educated can truly be free.
entries.philosopher_46: It is not wise to ignore your enemies.  They are often more perceptive than your friends.
entries.philosopher_45: Anything that doesn't make sense when spoken should be sung.
entries.philosopher_44: Every man is guilty of all the good that he did not do.
entries.philosopher_42: Only an educated man can entertain an idea without accepting it.
entries.philosopher_41: Take pleasure in your tasks, but put perfection in your work.
entries.philosopher_40: Striving for the best brings you closer to the best.
entries.philosopher_39: Poverty has many children, among them crime and revolution.
entries.philosopher_38: Being a good person and being a good citizen are not always the same thing.
entries.philosopher_37: We fight wars so that we can live in peace.
entries.philosopher_36: Nature does nothing that is useless.
entries.philosopher_35: Common ideals draw men together.  Even evil.
entries.philosopher_34: If your life is peaceful, pure, and refined, your old age should well be untroubled.
entries.philosopher_33: Advice should always be judged by its results.  Not its intentions.
entries.philosopher_32: Pure men need no laws.  Corrupt men break laws.  What part do laws then play in society?
entries.philosopher_31: No government has ever stood secure without a formidable opponent.
entries.philosopher_30: Its always better to learn from others misfortunes than your own.
entries.philosopher_29: Petty thieves are imprisoned.  Great thieves are elected.
entries.philosopher_28: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
entries.philosopher_27: Remember that life isn't stable.  Don't be overjoyed in your successes, or overwhelmed by your defeats.
entries.philosopher_26: Isn't it interesting how the man with a winning hand is always the most interested in playing fair?
entries.philosopher_25: There is nothing more despicable than a man who believes one thing with his heart and speaks another with his mouth.
entries.philosopher_24: Even a small rock can hold back a great wave.
entries.philosopher_23: Death is not the worst thing that can happen to anyone.
entries.philosopher_22: Never discourage anyone who makes progress, no matter how slow.
entries.philosopher_21: There is no concept of the many without the one.
entries.philosopher_20: There is nothing particularly exceptional about being old.  It merely means you've continued to live, not necessarily to learn.
entries.philosopher_19: There are relatively few musical notes.  But combinations of these give rise to more melodies than could ever be heard.
entries.philosopher_18: There are such things as roads that must not be followed, enemies that must not be attacked.
entries.philosopher_17: It is not excellent to win a war by fighting.  What is excellent is winning a war without fighting.
entries.philosopher_15: Do not mistake a man who is afraid to run away as courageous.
entries.philosopher_14: Fear is to be kept to oneself.  Courage is to be shared.
entries.philosopher_13: Courage means doing what you are afraid to do.  There is no courage without fear.
entries.philosopher_12: Any man who has confidence in himself earns the confidence of others.
entries.philosopher_11: The greatest fault is not to be conscious of your faults.
entries.philosopher_10: One person who has belief is as formidable as 100 people with 'interest'.
entries.philosopher_9: There are three stages to the truth:  First it will be ridiculed.  Then violently opposed.  Finally, accepted as obvious.
entries.philosopher_8: If you tell the truth 1000 times, and lie just once, you are still a liar.
entries.philosopher_7: The greatest teacher of all is failure.
entries.philosopher_6: If you seek an honest person, you should become one yourself.
entries.philosopher_5: All things are simple until made difficult by others.
entries.philosopher_4: Never walk away from a running rancor.
entries.philosopher_3: There is nothing foolproof in the universe.  You will find fools to be quite ingenious...
entries.philosopher_2: It's always easier to ask forgiveness then permission.
entries.philosopher_1: There is no such thing as trying.  Something can either be done, or it can't.
